name: Riley Sinema
title: Graduate Student at BYU
about: I am a graduate student at Brigham Young Univeristy studying computer science. I have experience with full stack development, data science, and machine learning.

projects.title: Researching Deep Learning Calibration
projects.description: Creating a new calibration method for deep learning models that is able to evaluate uncertainty on a per instance basis.

projects.title: EBook Vector Database
projects.description: A vector database that allows me to query all the eBooks on my machine based on a natural language query.

projects.title: Personalized RAG Chatbot
projects.description: A RAG chatbot that is able to answer questions about me based on data from my resume, projects, transcripts, and other sources.

projects.title: Gym Tracker Web App
projects.description: Group project lead by me to create a web app that allows users to track their gym progress and create custom workout plans.

timeline.title: Teaching Assistant for CS 452 Concepts of Database Design
description: Assisting students in learning about database design

timeline.title: Graduate Student
description: Conducting research in deep learning calibration and uncertainty estimation
Relevant coursework: Natural Language Processing, Adv Software Engineering

timeline.title: Full Stack Development Intern
description: Worked with senior engineers to refactor entire legacy codebase from .NET Framework to .NET Core
Collaborated with senior engineers on architecture decisions for the refactor

timeline.title: Teaching Assistant for CS 452 Concepts of Database Design
description: Assisted students in learning about database design
Created interactive labs to help students learn database systems

timeline.title: Bachelor's in Computer Science
description: Focus on Machine Learning and Software Engineering
